DataElement.preferredName: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Treatment Referral Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator for the treatment or referral (sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services) for pain from any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Pain Treatment Referral Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the treatment or referral (sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services) for pain from any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A disorder that affects the masticatory muscles and temporomandibular joint.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Dental Pain Treatment Referral Administered Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: an event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied as it refers to dental pain being treated or referred for treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
